subject: Management
title: Transparent Communication
description: A fast breakdown of Transparent Communication for builders.

hook.text: A company said nothing about layoffs. The rumor mill filled the vacuum with worse-than-reality stories.

buildup.text: In the absence of information, people invent narratives. And invented narratives are always worse.

discovery.text: Transparency builds trust. Even saying we don't know yet is better than silence.

twist.text: Leaders avoid transparency to prevent panic. The silence creates more panic than the truth would.

climax.text: Share what you know, what you don't, and when you'll have more information. Fill the vacuum yourself.

punchline.text: If you don't fill the silence, rumors will.

quiz.question: Why is transparency critical during change?
options: Without information, people invent worse narratives than the reality
Sharing uncertainty always causes more panic than silence
Transparency is only important after the change is complete
